info.description: Here is the list of REST APIs available
info.title: UBE REST API

tags.name: o-auth-controller
tags.description: For authentication via OAuth on supported third party services.

tags.name: file-upload-controller
tags.description: Upload files to add to your library

tags.name: mid-rec-screen-module-controller
tags.description: Handles the management of custom receiving screen modules

tags.name: follow-up-controller
tags.description: Tracking emails and offline data consumption associated with a presentation

tags.name: mido-auth-controller
tags.description: For authentication via OAuth from the MID Library Auth Service

tags.name: screen-controller
tags.description: Managing and interacting with screen sessions and screens

tags.name: analytics-controller
tags.description: For submitting statistical data and retrieving it for analysis

tags.name: dropbox-controller
tags.description: Access and share a user's Dropbox files

tags.name: mid-authentication-controller
tags.description: For authentication for an MID via user/pw

tags.name: comms-factory-controller
tags.description: Actions for the HP Communications Factory

tags.name: user-portal-controller
tags.description: Web interface for users to manage users, assets, modules, and companies.

tags.name: mid-links-controller
tags.description: Generation and handling of MID share links.

Login a user with email and password. In case of failure the call will return an error code and a message indicating reason for failure. The possible error messages are1) Invalid login information.  Please try again - when the user email is not found in the system or theusername and password does not match2) Your account has not been verified - user account found but the account is not verified yet3) User must finish password reset process by clicking the email link the user received - when user did not complete the password reset process

post.summary: Share files from your Dropbox account.  They will be converted and added to your file library.  The parameters are dynamic and follow this pattern: file_0_path, file_0_url (optional), file_0_rev (optional), file_0_group_id (optional), file_0_folder_id (optional).  You can have as many entries as you want.  Each new file needs a new number, e.g. file_7_path
